column5: Had a great weekend in Presque Isle Bay Erie, Pa.  Caught 40 bass with the biggest being 22 inches.  Took my girlfriend fishing who never really fished before and she didn't want to stop fishing.  If you have never fished Lake Erie in Pennsylvania, you should definetely consider stopping there for a weekend.  You will not be disappointed.   I am always happy when you take a novice person fishing and put them on fish.  It is so much better to see them catching them and having a blast.
Oh rub it in why dont you lol. Season does not start here for another month or so... Great fish tho, very nice

Thank you for the compliment.  I am not rubbing it in though!  I am just proud of the fish she caught.  I am sharing this information with all of you since you all have helped me many times before when I had questions about fishing in Canada.  If anybody wanted to fish this part of Lake Erie let me know and I might be able to give you some information that would be helpful.  It is only 2 hours from Buffalo, NY.
TOADS WOW  Thanks for sharing.
Ok.....ROADTRIP, lets go sink his boat!  Just kidding, nice fish!
You are right, it's always more fun getting newbies on to some fish. Great work!
your killing me  great fish and I can't fish for them till the end of June around here......
wow, some beauty smallmouth's! Counting down the day's until bass opens up
Awesome fish and hopefully another angler hooked for life.  Great work getting the missus involved.
Some real pigs there !!! Great stuff. Many places to hit them in Ontario right now.. but ya still might have to drill a hole !
Nice pics, some real hawgs there! I will be visiting some of their cousins in NY waters tomorrow!!!
nice donkeys!!
"SHOTGUN" Pick me up on the way... you'll be the guy with the flashing lights, right?
Man your so lucky to be able to fish for them.... have to wait until mid June for opener up here  Congratulations to all of you Those are huge SMB's!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman

I fished Lady Evelyn lake 2 years ago and booked my trip the week before smallmouth opened and couldn't fish for them.  It was my fault for not paying attention to detail! Thanks for the replies.  Hope you all have a great season too.
nice smalljaws!!!  I agree it is satisfying to teach new fishers the way!  Great job down there and have a great season.
Very nice smallies there ! Your gettin me very excited. I think that I should get down there for some of those hogs. Thanks for posting .
fantastic looking fish and way to make us jealous up here...
They're nice fish I guess.    My 40 pound muskie calls them dessert.   Nice fish Mike.   You'll have to let me tag along soon.
Nice pigs. Erie is faumous for SM. Can you share with us your tehnique? Line, lure type?  Congrats again.

Lake Erie technique is pretty simple.  She was jigging or dragging a 3" dark green Tube bait with a 1/4 ounce led head inside the tube (we call them Gitzits) on the bottom of the lake.  We were drifting from 22 feet deep up into about 9 feet deep when that big smb hit.  Not sure what tubes are available in Canada but the ones that have the most success in Pennsylvania in my opinion is called an M200.  Hope that answered your question.
Thank you for your fast answer. I like the fight with SM. My Regards.
